intro: Ardisia nhatrangensis var. neurophylla, commonly known as the Nhatrang ardisia, is a rare shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
